column1: Information Exposure
column2: MidiCart stores the midicart.mdb database file under the Web document root, which allows remote attackers to steal sensitive information by directly requesting the database.
column3: What vulnerability does MidiCart expose by storing the midicart.mdb database file under the Web document root?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: PHP file inclusion vulnerability in osCommerce 2.1 execute arbitrary commands via the include_file parameter to include_once.php.
column3: What are the potential risks associated with the PHP file inclusion vulnerability found in osCommerce 2.1, specifically regarding the include_file parameter in include_once.php?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Ikonboard 3.1.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a private message with a javascript: URL in the IMG tag, in which the URL ends in a ".gif" or ".jpg" string, a variant of CVE-2002-0328.
column3: What type of vulnerability does Ikonboard 3.1.1 have that allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML, and what is the specific method used for this injection?

column1: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')
column2: sshd in OpenSSH 3.6.1p2 and earlier, when PermitRootLogin is disabled and using PAM keyboard-interactive authentication, does not insert a delay after a root login attempt with the correct password, which makes it easier for remote attackers to use timing differences to determine if the password step of a multi-step authentication is successful, a different vulnerability than CVE-2003-0190.
column3: What vulnerability was identified in OpenSSH 3.6.1p2 and earlier related to root login attempts and PAM keyboard-interactive authentication?

column1: Improper Authentication
column2: Session fixation vulnerability in Macromedia JRun 4.0 allows remote attackers to hijack user sessions by pre-setting the user session ID information used by the session server.
column3: What is the session fixation vulnerability in Macromedia JRun 4.0 and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Configuration
column2: distcc 2.x, as used in XCode 1.5 and others, when not configured to restrict access to the server port, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via compilation jobs, which are executed by the server without authorization checks.
column3: What security vulnerability does distcc 2.x present when used in XCode 1.5 and other applications if it is not properly configured to restrict access?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: Unrestricted file upload vulnerability in AspDotNetStorefront 3.3 allows remote authenticated administrators to upload arbitrary files with executable extensions via admin/images.aspx.
column3: What type of vulnerability exists in AspDotNetStorefront 3.3 that allows remote authenticated administrators to upload executable files?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in FutureSoft TFTP Server Evaluation Version 1.0.0.1 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long (1) filename or (2) transfer mode string in a Read Request (RRQ) or Write Request (WRQ) packet.
column3: What vulnerabilities are present in FutureSoft TFTP Server Evaluation Version 1.0.0.1 that allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code?

column1: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
column2: Directory traversal vulnerability in FutureSoft TFTP Server Evaluation Version 1.0.0.1 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a TFTP GET request containing (1) "../" (dot dot slash) or (2) "..\" (dot dot backslash) sequences.
column3: What type of vulnerability is present in FutureSoft TFTP Server Evaluation Version 1.0.0.1 and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Apache Derby before 10.1.2.1 exposes the (1) user and (2) password attributes in cleartext via (a) the RDBNAM parameter of the ACCSEC command and (b) the output of the DatabaseMetaData.getURL function, which allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in Apache Derby versions prior to 10.1.2.1 that allowed context-dependent attackers to access sensitive user and password information?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Heap-based buffer overflow in Pedro Lineu Orso chetcpasswd before 2.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a long X-Forwarded-For HTTP header.  NOTE: The provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with heap-based buffer overflow in Pedro Lineu Orso chetcpasswd versions prior to 2.4, and how can they be exploited?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Multiple off-by-one errors in fsplib.c in fsplib before 0.8 allow attackers to cause a denial of service via unspecified vectors involving the (1) name and (2) d_name entry attributes.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in fsplib.c before version 0.8 that could allow attackers to execute a denial of service attack?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: The skge driver 1.5 in Linux kernel 2.6.15 on Ubuntu does not properly use the spin_lock and spin_unlock functions, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (machine crash) via a flood of network traffic.
column3: What vulnerability exists in the skge driver 1.5 in Linux kernel 2.6.15 on Ubuntu that can lead to a denial of service attack?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: WebCore in Apple WebKit build 18794 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (null dereference and application crash) via a TD element with a large number in the ROWSPAN attribute, as demonstrated by a crash of OmniWeb 5.5.3 on Mac OS X 10.4.8, a different vulnerability than CVE-2006-2019.
column3: What vulnerability in WebCore of Apple WebKit build 18794 can lead to a denial of service and how can it be exploited?

column1: Numeric Errors
column2: Integer overflow in the 16 bit variable reference counter in PHP 4 allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code by overflowing this counter, which causes the same variable to be destroyed twice, a related issue to CVE-2007-1286.
column3: What vulnerability allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code in PHP 4 by exploiting the integer overflow in the 16-bit variable reference counter?

column3: What is the session fixation vulnerability in eXV2 CMS 2.0.4.3, and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: myWebland myBloggie 2.1.6 allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via (1) an invalid year parameter to calendar.php, reached through index.php; (2) a direct request to common.php; and (3) a mode array parameter in the query string to login.php, which reveal the installation path in various error messages.
column3: What vulnerabilities are present in myWebland myBloggie 2.1.6 that allow remote attackers to access sensitive information?

column1: Information Exposure

column3: What type of vulnerability is present in the Farsi Script FaName 1.0, and what parameter is exploited to execute arbitrary SQL commands?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

Upgrade to Vista Service Pack 1

column1: Information Exposure
column2:
An attacker can identify a CISCO device by sending a SYN packet to port 1999, which is for the Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP). Please see the following link for more information:

http://seclists.org/bugtraq/1999/Jan/0215.html
column3: What type of packet can an attacker send to identify a CISCO device, and which port is used for this process?

column1: Numeric Errors
column2: member2.php in vBulletin 2.2.9 and earlier does not properly restrict the $perpage variable to be an integer, which causes an error message to be reflected back to the user without quoting, which facilitates cross-site scripting (XSS) and possibly other attacks.

column1: Numeric Errors
column2: ftpd in NetBSD 1.5 through 1.5.3 and 1.6 does not properly quote a digit in response to a STAT command for a filename that contains a carriage return followed by a digit, which can cause firewalls and other intermediary devices to lose proper track of the FTP session.

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: The "System Restore" directory and subdirectories, and possibly other subdirectories in the "System Volume Information" directory on Windows XP Professional, have insecure access control list (ACL) permissions, which allows local users to access restricted files and modify registry settings.

column3: What vulnerabilities exist in Bajie Java HTTP Server versions 0.95 through 0.95zxv4 that allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML?

column1: Improper Input Validation

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

column1: Numeric Errors
column2: Multiple integer overflows in Sbus PROM driver (drivers/sbus/char/openprom.c) for the Linux kernel 2.4.x up to 2.4.27, 2.6.x up to 2.6.7, and possibly later versions, allow local users to execute arbitrary code by specifying (1) a small buffer size to the copyin_string function or (2) a negative buffer size to the copyin function.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in the Sbus PROM driver of the Linux kernel versions 2.4.x up to 2.4.27 and 2.6.x up to 2.6.7, and what methods can local users use to exploit these vulnerabilities?

column2: functions.php in Ragnarok Online Control Panel (ROCP) 4.3.4a allows remote attackers to bypass authentication by requesting account_manage.php with a trailing "/login.php" PHP_SELF value, which is not properly handled by the CHECK_AUTH function.

column2: The search functionality in XWiki 0.9.793 indexes cleartext user passwords, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a search string that matches a password.

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Community Server allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unknown attack vectors.  NOTE: this candidate does not contain any actionable or distinguishing information.  Perhaps it should not be included in CVE.  NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information.
column3: What are the potential risks associated with the multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities found in Community Server, and why might this information not be considered suitable for inclusion in the CVE database?

column1: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
column2: Directory traversal vulnerability in jetty 6.0.x (jetty6) beta16 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a %2e%2e%5c (encoded ../) in the URL.  NOTE: this might be the same issue as CVE-2005-3747.
column3: What is the nature of the directory traversal vulnerability identified in Jetty 6.0.x beta16, and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Fujitsu ServerView 2.50 up to 3.60L98 and 4.10L11 up to 4.11L81 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors. This vulnerability is addressed in the following product releases:
Fujitsu, ServerView, 3.60L99
Fujitsu, ServerView, 4.20L11B
column3: What versions of Fujitsu ServerView are vulnerable to the cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability, and which releases address this issue?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Dokeos before 1.6.5 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in Dokeos versions prior to 1.6.5 that could allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML?

column1: Credentials Management
column2: The pswd.js script relies on the client to calculate whether a username and password match hard-coded hashed values for a server, and uses a hashing scheme that creates a large number of collisions, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct offline brute force attacks.  NOTE: this script might also allow attackers to generate the server-side "secret" URL without determining the original password, but this possibility was not discussed by the original researcher.
column3: What security vulnerabilities does the pswd.js script exhibit due to its reliance on client-side calculations for username and password verification?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: The Database module in Moodle before 1.6.2 does not properly handle uploaded files, which has unspecified impact and remote attack vectors.
column3: What security vulnerabilities are associated with the Database module in Moodle versions prior to 1.6.2 regarding uploaded files?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: Moodle before 1.6.2 does not properly validate the module instance id when creating a course module object, which has unspecified impact and remote attack vectors.
column3: What vulnerabilities were present in Moodle versions prior to 1.6.2 regarding the validation of module instance IDs?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: Mozilla Firefox 2.0, possibly only when running on Windows, allows remote attackers to bypass the Phishing Protection mechanism by representing an IP address in (1) dotted-hex, (2) dotted-octal, (3) single decimal integer, (4) single hex integer, or (5) single octal integer format, which is not captured by the blacklist filter.
column3: What methods can remote attackers use to bypass the Phishing Protection mechanism in Mozilla Firefox 2.0 when running on Windows?

column1: Improper Authentication
column2: Unspecified vulnerability in a cryptographic feature in MailEnable Standard Edition before 1.93, Professional Edition before 1.73, and Enterprise Edition before 1.21 leads to "weakened authentication security" with unknown impact and attack vectors.  NOTE: due to lack of details, it is not clear whether this is the same as CVE-2006-1792.
column3: What implications does the unspecified vulnerability in MailEnable's cryptographic feature have on authentication security, and how does it compare to CVE-2006-1792?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: attachment.php in Headstart Solutions DeskPRO allows remote attackers to read all uploaded files by providing the file number in a modified id parameter.
column3: What vulnerability in Headstart Solutions DeskPRO's attachment.php file allows remote attackers to gain access to uploaded files?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: PHP remote file inclusion vulnerability in cmpro.intern/login.inc.php for Clan Manager Pro (CMPRO) 1.1.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via a URL in the rootpath parameter.  NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information. Successful exploitation requires that "register_globals" is enabled.
column3: What are the potential risks and requirements for exploiting the PHP remote file inclusion vulnerability found in Clan Manager Pro (CMPRO) 1.1.0?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: PreviewAction in XWiki 0.9.543 through 0.9.1252 does not set the Author field to the identity of the user who last modified a document, which allows remote authenticated users without programming rights to execute arbitrary code by selecting a document whose author has programming rights, modifying this document to contain a script, and previewing without saving the document.
column3: What vulnerability in XWiki versions 0.9.543 to 0.9.1252 allows remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary code through the PreviewAction feature?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: The NFS client implementation in the kernel in Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 3, when a filesystem is mounted with the noacl option, checks permissions for the open system call via vfs_permission (mode bits) data rather than an NFS ACCESS call to the server, which allows local client processes to obtain a false success status from open calls that the server would deny, and possibly obtain sensitive information about file permissions on the server, as demonstrated in a root_squash environment.  NOTE: it is uncertain whether any scenarios involving this issue cross privilege boundaries.
column3: What are the implications of the NFS client implementation in RHEL 3 when using the noacl option, particularly regarding permission checks and potential security risks?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: The Bonjour functionality in iChat in Apple Mac OS X 10.3.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (persistent application crash) via unspecified vectors, possibly related to CVE-2007-0614.
column3: What vulnerabilities in the Bonjour functionality of iChat in Apple Mac OS X 10.3.9 can lead to a denial of service, and how might they relate to CVE-2007-0614?

column1: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')
column2: Race condition in the tee (sys_tee) system call in the Linux kernel 2.6.17 through 2.6.17.6 might allow local users to cause a denial of service (system crash), obtain sensitive information (kernel memory contents), or gain privileges via unspecified vectors related to a potentially dropped ipipe lock during a race between two pipe readers.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in the tee (sys_tee) system call in the Linux kernel versions 2.6.17 to 2.6.17.6, and what potential consequences could they impose on local users?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: The wddx_deserialize function in wddx.c 1.119.2.10.2.12 and 1.119.2.10.2.13 in PHP 5, as modified in CVS on 20070224 and fixed on 20070304, calls strlcpy where strlcat was intended and uses improper arguments, which allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code via a WDDX packet with a malformed overlap of a STRING element, which triggers a buffer overflow. This vulnerability impacts PHP CVS as of 2007-02-24
column3: What vulnerability was identified in the wddx_deserialize function of PHP 5, and what impact does it have on the security of the system?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Buffer overflow in Yahoo! Messenger 8.1 allows user-assisted remote authenticated users, who are listed in an address book, to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors, aka ZD-00000005.  NOTE: this information is based upon a vague advisory by a vulnerability information sales organization that does not coordinate with vendors or release actionable advisories. A CVE has been assigned for tracking purposes, but duplicates with other CVEs are difficult to determine.
column3: What are the potential security risks associated with the buffer overflow vulnerability in Yahoo! Messenger 8.1?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: IBM DB2 Universal Database (UDB) Administration Server (DAS) 8 before Fix Pack 16 and 9 before Fix Pack 4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via modified pointer values in unspecified remote administration requests, which triggers memory corruption or other invalid memory access. NOTE: this might be the same issue as CVE-2008-0698.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in IBM DB2 Universal Database (UDB) Administration Server versions 8 before Fix Pack 16 and 9 before Fix Pack 4 that could allow remote attackers to disrupt service or execute arbitrary code?

column1: Improper Authentication
column2: The login method in LoginModule implementations in Apache Geronimo 2.0 does not throw FailedLoginException for failed logins, which allows remote attackers to bypass authentication requirements, deploy arbitrary modules, and gain administrative access by sending a blank username and password with the command line deployer in the deployment module.
column3: What security vulnerability exists in the login method of LoginModule implementations in Apache Geronimo 2.0 that allows remote attackers to bypass authentication?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the webacc servlet in Novell GroupWise 6.5 WebAccess allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the User.Id parameter, as demonstrated by a URL within a url field in a STYLE element, possibly due to an incomplete fix for CVE-2004-2103.2.
column3: What is the nature of the cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability found in Novell GroupWise 6.5 WebAccess, and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: Yahoo! Messenger 8.1.0.209 and 8.1.0.402 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via certain file-transfer packets, possibly involving a buffer overflow, as demonstrated by ym8bug.exe.  NOTE: this might be related to CVE-2007-4515.  NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information.
column3: What vulnerability in Yahoo! Messenger versions 8.1.0.209 and 8.1.0.402 can be exploited by remote attackers to cause application crashes, and what is the potential relationship to CVE-2007-4515?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: The Services API in Firebird before 2.0.2 allows remote authenticated users without SYSDBA privileges to read the server log (firebird.log), aka CORE-1148.
column3: What vulnerability was identified in Firebird's Services API before version 2.0.2 regarding remote authenticated users and access to the server log?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in admin/adminusers.php in Claroline before 1.8.6 allows remote authenticated administrators to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the sort parameter. column3: What are the potential implications of the XSS vulnerability found in Claroline before version 1.8.6 related to the sort parameter in admin/adminusers.php?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: JFFS2, as used on One Laptop Per Child (OLPC) build 542 and possibly other Linux systems, when POSIX ACL support is enabled, does not properly store permissions during (1) inode creation or (2) ACL setting, which might allow local users to access restricted files or directories after a remount of a filesystem, related to "legacy modes" and an inconsistency between dentry permissions and inode permissions.
column3: What issues are associated with JFFS2 when POSIX ACL support is enabled on Linux systems like OLPC build 542, particularly regarding inode creation and ACL setting?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: ips_kernel/class_upload.php in Invision Power Board (IPB or IP.Board) 2.3.1 up to 20070912 allows remote attackers to upload arbitrary script files with crafted image filenames to uploads/, where they are saved with a .txt extension and are not executable.  NOTE: there are limited usage scenarios under which this would be a vulnerability, but it is being tracked by CVE since the vendor has stated it is security-relevant.
column3: What security risks are associated with the file upload vulnerability in ips_kernel/class_upload.php of Invision Power Board versions 2.3.1 up to 20070912?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: EMC VMware Server before 1.0.4 Build 56528 writes passwords in cleartext to unspecified log files, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading these files, a different vulnerability than CVE-2005-3620.
column3: What security vulnerability is associated with EMC VMware Server versions before 1.0.4 Build 56528, and how does it differ from CVE-2005-3620?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Dibbler 0.6.0 on Linux uses weak world-writable permissions for unspecified files in /var/lib/dibbler, which has unknown impact and local attack vectors.

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in buscar.asp in Solidweb Novus 1.0 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the p parameter.  NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information.

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: Multiple PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in Puzzle Apps CMS 2.2.1 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via a URL in the MODULEDIR parameter to (1) core/modules/my/my.module.php or (2) core/modules/xml/xml.module.php; the COREROOT parameter to (3) config.loader.php, (4) platform.loader.php, (5) core.loader.php, (6) person.loader.php, or (7) module.loader.php in core/ or (8) install/steps/step_3.php; or the THISDIR parameter to (9) people.lib.php, (10) general.lib.php, (11) content.lib.php, or (12) templates.lib.php in core/modules/admin/libs/ or (13) core/modules/webstat/MEC/index.php.

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: The ntfs-3g package before 1.913-2.fc7 in Fedora 7, and an ntfs-3g package in Ubuntu 7.10/Gutsy, assign incorrect permissions (setuid root) to mount.ntfs-3g, which allows local users with fuse group membership to read from and write to arbitrary block devices, possibly involving a file descriptor leak.
column3: What security vulnerability was identified in the ntfs-3g package before version 1.913-2.fc7 in Fedora 7 and in Ubuntu 7.10/Gutsy regarding permissions for mount.ntfs-3g?

column3: What is the nature of the vulnerability found in phpLister 0.5-pre2 related to the .systeme/fonctions.php file, and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in iletisim.asp in Y&K Iletisim Formu allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) ad, (2) sehir, (3) yas, (4) cins, (5) tel, (6) mail, and (7) mesaj parameters.  NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information.

column2: irc_server.c in dircproxy 1.2.0 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via an ACTION command without a parameter, which triggers a NULL pointer dereference, as demonstrated using a blank /me message from irssi.
column3: What vulnerability in dircproxy versions 1.2.0 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a segmentation fault through the ACTION command, and how can it be demonstrated?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Heap-based buffer overflow in the activePDF Server service (aka APServer.exe) in activePDF Server 3.8.4 and 3.8.5.14, and possibly other versions before 3.8.6.16, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a packet with a size field that is less than the actual size of the data.
column3: What vulnerability exists in activePDF Server versions 3.8.4 and 3.8.5.14 that allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Unspecified vulnerability in Cisco IOS allows remote attackers to obtain the IOS version via unspecified vectors involving a "common network service", aka PSIRT-1255024833.  NOTE: as of 20071016, the only disclosure is a vague pre-advisory with no actionable information.  However, since it is from a well-known researcher, it is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.

column2: Integer overflow in Cisco IOS allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.  NOTE: as of 20071016, the only disclosure is a vague pre-advisory with no actionable information. However, since it is from a well-known researcher, it is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.
column3: What vulnerabilities associated with integer overflow in Cisco IOS have been reported, and what is the current status of the disclosures related to these vulnerabilities?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Oracle allows remote attackers to obtain server memory contents via crafted packets, aka Oracle reference number 7892711.  NOTE: as of 20071016, the only disclosure is a vague pre-advisory with no actionable information. However, since it is from a well-known researcher, it is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.
column3: What is the significance of Oracle reference number 7892711 in relation to server memory security vulnerabilities?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Unspecified vulnerability in Symantec Altiris Deployment Solution allows attackers to obtain authentication credentials via unknown vectors, aka "Authentication Credentials Information Leakage in Altiris Deployment Solution."  NOTE: this description is based on a vague pre-advisory with no actionable information. However, since it is from a well-known researcher, it is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.
column3: What is the nature of the vulnerability found in Symantec Altiris Deployment Solution and what potential risk does it pose to users?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: Unspecified vulnerability in the Avaya VoIP Handset allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (reboot) via crafted packets. NOTE: as of 20071016, the only disclosure is a vague pre-advisory with no actionable information. However, since it is from a well-known researcher, it is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.
column3: What are the potential implications of the unspecified vulnerability in the Avaya VoIP Handset that allows remote attackers to induce a denial of service through crafted packets?

column1: Numeric Errors
column2: Integer overflow in the LG Mobile handset allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (reboot) via a crafted HTTP packet.  NOTE: as of 20071016, the only disclosure is a vague pre-advisory with no actionable information. However, since it is from a well-known researcher, it is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.
column3: What potential security vulnerability has been identified in LG Mobile handsets, and what is the consequence of this vulnerability when exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Heap-based buffer overflow in the IBM ThinkVantage TPM Service allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTTP packet. NOTE: as of 20071016, the only disclosure is a vague pre-advisory with no actionable information. However, since it is from a well-known researcher, it is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in the IBM ThinkVantage TPM Service that could potentially allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

However, since it is from a well-known researcher, it is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.
column3: What vulnerabilities in the Juniper HTTP Service can allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code, and what is the current status of information regarding this issue?

column1: Use of Externally-Controlled Format String
column2: Format string vulnerability in the logging function in the Oracle OPMN daemon, as used on Oracle Enterprise Grid Console server 10.2.0.1, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the URI in an HTTP request to port 6003, aka Oracle reference number 6296175.  NOTE: this might be the same issue as CVE-2007-0282 or CVE-2007-0280, but there are insufficient details to be sure.
column3: What is the nature of the format string vulnerability found in the Oracle OPMN daemon, and how can it potentially be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: xscreensaver 5.03 and earlier, when running without xscreensaver-gl-extras (GL extras) installed, crashes when /usr/bin/xscreensaver-gl-helper does not exist and a user attempts to unlock the screen, which allows attackers with physical access to gain access to the locked session.
column3: What vulnerability was discovered in xscreensaver versions 5.03 and earlier regarding screen unlocking when GL extras are not installed?

column1: Improper Authentication
column2: The Gentoo ebuild of MLDonkey before 2.9.0-r3 has a p2p user account with an empty default password and valid login shell, which might allow remote attackers to obtain login access and execute arbitrary code.
column3: What security vulnerability exists in the Gentoo ebuild of MLDonkey before version 2.9.0-r3 that could potentially allow remote attackers to gain unauthorized access?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: Untrusted search path vulnerability in db2pd in IBM DB2 Universal Database (UDB) 8 before FixPak 16 and 9 before Fix Pack 4 allows local users to gain root privileges via a modified DB2INSTANCE environment variable that points to a malicious library.  NOTE: this might be the same issue as CVE-2008-0697.
column3: What exploit does the untrusted search path vulnerability in db2pd of IBM DB2 Universal Database allow local users to perform, and what specific environment variable is involved?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

NOTE: the netkit-ftpd issue is covered by CVE-2007-6263.
column3: What potential security risks does the double free vulnerability in the getreply function of netkit ftp (version 0.17 20040614 and later) pose, and how is it classified in relation to CVE-2007-6263?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: The CryptGenRandom function in Microsoft Windows 2000 generates predictable values, which makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to reduce the effectiveness of cryptographic mechanisms, as demonstrated by attacks on (1) forward security and (2) backward security, related to use of eight instances of the RC4 cipher, and possibly a related issue to CVE-2007-3898.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with the CryptGenRandom function in Microsoft Windows 2000, particularly in relation to the RC4 cipher and cryptographic security?

The vendor has addressed this issue through the release of the following product updates:

Ignite Realtime openfire-3.3.1-1.i386.rpm
http://www.igniterealtime.org/downloads/download-landing.jsp?file=open fire/openfire-3.3.1-1.i386.rpm

Ignite Realtime openfire_3_3_1.dmg
http://www.igniterealtime.org/downloads/download-landing.jsp?file=open fire/openfire_3_3_1.dmg

Ignite Realtime openfire_3_3_1.exe
http://www.igniterealtime.org/downloads/download-landing.jsp?file=open fire/openfire_3_3_1.exe

column3: What security vulnerability exists in BEA WebLogic Server 9.1 that allows attackers to bypass intended restrictions due to improper handling of an admin server's security policy change log?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: Memory leak in server/MaraDNS.c in MaraDNS before 1.2.12.05, and 1.3.x before 1.3.03, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via unspecified vectors, a different set of affected versions than CVE-2007-3115 and CVE-2007-3116.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with memory leaks in MaraDNS versions prior to 1.2.12.05 and 1.3.03, and how can they be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-domain vulnerability in Apple Safari for Windows 3.0.1 allows remote attackers to bypass the "same origin policy" and access restricted information from other domains via JavaScript that overwrites the document variable and statically sets the document.domain attribute.
column3: What is the nature of the cross-domain vulnerability found in Apple Safari for Windows 3.0.1, and how does it allow remote attackers to access restricted information?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
column2: SQL injection vulnerability in MKPortal 1.1.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via unspecified vectors, aka ZD-00000008.  this information is based upon a vague advisory by a vulnerability information sales organization that does not coordinate with vendors or release actionable advisories. A CVE has been assigned for tracking purposes, but duplicates with other CVEs are difficult to determine.
column3: What are the potential risks and implications of the SQL injection vulnerability in MKPortal 1.1.1, and how does it relate to the tracking of CVEs?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in fsplib.c in fsplib before 0.9 might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) a long filename that is not properly handled by the fsp_readdir_native function when MAXNAMLEN is greater than 255, or (2) a long d_name directory (dirent) field in the fsp_readdir function.
column3: What vulnerabilities in fsplib versions prior to 0.9 could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code through stack-based buffer overflows?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: webbatch.exe in WebBatch allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via the dumpinputdata parameter.
column3: What security vulnerability is associated with the webbatch.exe in WebBatch that allows remote attackers to access sensitive information?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: Invensys Wonderware InTouch 8.0 creates a NetDDE share with insecure permissions (Everyone/Full Control), which allows remote authenticated attackers, and possibly anonymous users, to execute arbitrary programs.
column3: What security vulnerability is associated with Invensys Wonderware InTouch 8.0, and what permissions contribute to this issue?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: Untrusted search path vulnerability in yast2-core in SUSE Linux might allow local users to execute arbitrary code by creating a malicious yast2 module in the current working directory.
column3: What is the potential risk associated with the untrusted search path vulnerability in yast2-core in SUSE Linux?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: Multiple PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in CutePHP CuteNews 1.3.6 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via unspecified vectors. column3: What are the potential risks associated with the PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities found in CutePHP CuteNews 1.3.6, and how might they overlap with previously identified CVEs?

column3: What is the nature of the cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability found in Pyrophobia 2.1.3.1, and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: Multiple PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in myphpPagetool 0.4.3 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via a URL in the ptinclude parameter to (1) help1.php, (2) help2.php, (3) help3.php, (4) help4.php, (5) help5.php, (6) help6.php, (7) help7.php, (7) help8.php, (8) help9.php, or (10) index.php in doc/admin/.
column3: What are the potential security risks associated with multiple PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities found in myphpPagetool 0.4.3, specifically regarding the execution of arbitrary PHP code?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: Multiple PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in Webmedia Explorer (webmex) 3.2.2 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via (1) a URL in the path_include parameter to includes/rss.class.php, (2) a URL in the path_template parameter to (a) templates/main.tpl.php or (b) templates/folder_messages_link_message_name.tpl.php, or (4) a URL in the path_templates parameter to templates/sidebar.tpl.php.  NOTE: the vulnerability is present only when the administrator does not follow installation instructions about the requirement for .htaccess support. NOTE: the includes/core.lib.php vector is already covered by CVE-2006-5252.
column3: What are the specific parameters in Webmedia Explorer 3.2.2 that are vulnerable to remote file inclusion attacks, and what prerequisites must administrators meet to mitigate these vulnerabilities?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: The login_to_simulator method in Linden Lab Second Life, as used by the secondlife:// protocol handler and possibly other Second Life login mechanisms, sends an MD5 hash in cleartext in the passwd field, which allows remote attackers to login to an account by sniffing the network and then sending this hash to a Second Life authentication server.
column3: What security vulnerability is present in the login_to_simulator method of Linden Lab Second Life regarding the handling of passwords?

column1: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
column2: cp, when running with an option to preserve symlinks on multiple OSes, allows local, user-assisted attackers to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack using crafted directories containing multiple source files that are copied to the same destination.
column3: What are the security implications of using the cp command with symlink preservation options on multiple operating systems, specifically regarding symlink attacks?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: Multiple PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in pSlash 0.70 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via a URL in (1) the lvc_admin_dir parameter to modules/visitors2/admin/view-archiver.inc.php or (2) the lvc_include_dir parameter to modules/visitors2/include/menus.inc.php. NOTE: the modules/visitors2/include/config.inc.php vector is already covered by CVE-2006-4373.  NOTE: vector 1 is disputed by CVE because PHP encounters a fatal instantiation error on a direct request for the file, before reaching the include statement.
column3: What vulnerabilities are present in pSlash 0.70 that allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code, and how do they relate to the parameters lvc_admin_dir and lvc_include_dir?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

NOTE: vectors 4 and 5 are disputed by CVE because PHP encounters a fatal function-call error on a direct request for the file, before reaching the include statement.
column3: What are the specific files in which remote attackers can exploit PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in Dedi-group Der Dirigent 1.0 by manipulating the dedi_path parameter?

The novell-groupwise-client package is only contained in SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 10 and was updated there.

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.22, and other 5 through 6 SP1 versions, sends Referer headers containing https:// URLs in requests for http:// URLs, which allows remote attackers to obtain potentially sensitive information by reading Referer log data. The only versions confirmed with this vulnerability are the ones listed in the CPE entry.  Other IE Versions may, and probably are, affected but have not been confirmed yet.
column3: What is the security vulnerability associated with Microsoft Internet Explorer versions 5.22 and 5 through 6 SP1, and how does it potentially expose sensitive information to remote attackers?

column1: Configuration
column2: sshd in OpenSSH 3.5p1, when PermitRootLogin is disabled, immediately closes the TCP connection after a root login attempt with the correct password, but leaves the connection open after an attempt with an incorrect password, which makes it easier for remote attackers to guess the password by observing the connection state, a different vulnerability than CVE-2003-0190.  NOTE: it could be argued that in most environments, this does not cross privilege boundaries without requiring leverage of a separate vulnerability.
column3: What is the security implication of sshd in OpenSSH 3.5p1 closing the TCP connection immediately after a correct root login attempt when PermitRootLogin is disabled, compared to the behavior after an incorrect password attempt?

column1: Improper Authentication
column2:
Cisco Adaptive Security Appliances (ASA) 5500 Series and PIX Security Appliances 7.1(1) through 7.1(2)82, 7.2 before 7.2(4)27, 8.0 before 8.0(4)25, and 8.1 before 8.1(2)15, when AAA override-account-disable is entered in a general-attributes field, allow remote attackers to bypass authentication and establish a VPN session to an ASA device via unspecified vectors. Per vendor advisory: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080a994f6.shtml

"VPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability

Cisco ASA or Cisco PIX security appliances that are configured for IPsec or SSL-based remote access VPN and have the Override Account Disabled feature enabled are affected by this vulnerability.

Note:  The Override Account Disabled feature was introduced in Cisco ASA software version 7.1(1). Cisco ASA and PIX software versions 7.1, 7.2, 8.0, and 8.1 are affected by this vulnerability. This feature is disabled by default. "
column3: What vulnerability exists in Cisco ASA and PIX security appliances that allows remote attackers to bypass authentication and establish a VPN session, particularly when the Override Account Disabled feature is enabled?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2:
The Web Editor in Dassault Systemes ENOVIA SmarTeam V5 before Release 18 Service Pack 8, and possibly CATIA and other products, allows remote authenticated users to read the profile card of an object in the document class via a link that is sent from the owner of the document object. Per http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1HD80332

"Scenario:
1. Create a document class and give permissions to joe only.
2. When someone else but joe logs onto Web editor, and does a
   search on this new class no results are returned as expected.
3. Login as joe and search for an object created for this new
   class. click on the email icon, and send the mail to bob.
4. When bob clicks on the link in the email, he can view the
   profile card of the object, but when he clicks on viewer he
   gets an unauthorized operation error. Bob shouldn't be able
   to view the profile card in the first place as he doesn't
   have any access to this class.  This is a security hole in
   the web editor."
column3: What security vulnerability is identified in the Web Editor of Dassault Systemes ENOVIA SmarTeam V5 with respect to document class permissions?

column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in IBM Tivoli Identity Manager (ITIM) 5.0 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML by entering an unspecified URL in (1) the self-service UI interface or (2) the console interface. NOTE: it was later reported that 4.6.0 is also affected by the first vector.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in IBM Tivoli Identity Manager (ITIM) 5.0 that allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML, and which other version has also been affected by these vulnerabilities?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 through 6.0.2900.2180 and 7 through 7.0.6000.16473 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via an XML document composed of a long series of start-tags with no corresponding end-tags, a related issue to CVE-2009-1232.
column3: What vulnerability allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 and 7 through excessive CPU consumption, related to CVE-2009-1232?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in phpMyAdmin before 3.2.0.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted SQL bookmark.
column3: What type of vulnerability is present in phpMyAdmin versions before 3.2.0.1, and what can remote attackers exploit it to do?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: The administrative web interface on the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) platform 4.2 before 4.2.205.0 and 5.x before 5.2.178.0, as used in Cisco 1500 Series, 2000 Series, 2100 Series, 4100 Series, 4200 Series, and 4400 Series Wireless Services Modules (WiSM), WLC Modules for Integrated Services Routers, and Catalyst 3750G Integrated Wireless LAN Controllers, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (device reload) via a malformed response to a (1) HTTP or (2) HTTPS authentication request, aka Bug ID CSCsx03715.
column3: What vulnerability exists in the administrative web interface of Cisco Wireless LAN Controller platforms prior to specific versions, and what can remote attackers achieve by exploiting it?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: Memory leak on the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) platform 4.x before 4.2.205.0, 5.1 before 5.1.163.0, and 5.0 and 5.2 before 5.2.178.0, as used in Cisco 1500 Series, 2000 Series, 2100 Series, 4100 Series, 4200 Series, and 4400 Series Wireless Services Modules (WiSM), WLC Modules for Integrated Services Routers, and Catalyst 3750G Integrated Wireless LAN Controllers, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and device reload) via SSH management connections, aka Bug ID CSCsw40789.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller platform versions prior to 4.2.205.0, 5.1.163.0, and 5.2.178.0, and how can they be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Numeric Errors
column2: Mozilla Firefox 3.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via unspecified vectors, related to a "flash bug."
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in Mozilla Firefox 3.5 that could allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in mt-wizard.cgi in Six Apart Movable Type before 4.261 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2009-2480.
column3: What is the nature of the cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability found in mt-wizard.cgi in Six Apart Movable Type before version 4.261, and how does it differ from CVE-2009-2480?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in IBM Workplace for Business Controls and Reporting 2.x and IBM Workplace Web Content Management 6.x allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.  NOTE: some of these details are obtained from third party information.
column3: What is the nature of the cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability found in IBM Workplace for Business Controls and Reporting 2.x and IBM Workplace Web Content Management 6.x?

column1: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
column2: Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in IBM Workplace for Business Controls and Reporting 2.x and IBM Workplace Web Content Management 6.x has unknown impact and remote attack vectors.  NOTE: some of these details are obtained from third party information.
column3: What are the potential impacts and remote attack vectors associated with the CSRF vulnerability found in IBM Workplace for Business Controls and Reporting 2.x and IBM Workplace Web Content Management 6.x?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Buffer overflow in the PATinst function in src/load_pat.cpp in libmodplug before 0.8.7 allows user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via a long instrument name.
column3: What vulnerability was identified in the PATinst function of libmodplug before version 0.8.7, and what potential impacts can it have?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: src/tools/pkcs11-tool.c in pkcs11-tool in OpenSC 0.11.7, when used with unspecified third-party PKCS#11 modules, generates RSA keys with incorrect public exponents, which allows attackers to read the cleartext form of messages that were intended to be encrypted.
column3: What vulnerability exists in the pkcs11-tool of OpenSC 0.11.7 when used with certain third-party PKCS#11 modules, and what potential attack does it enable?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: XScreenSaver in Sun Solaris 10 and OpenSolaris before snv_109, and Solaris 8 and 9 with GNOME 2.0 or 2.0.2, allows physically proximate attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading popup windows, which are displayed even when the screen is locked, as demonstrated by Thunderbird new-mail notifications.
column3: What vulnerability exists in XScreenSaver on Sun Solaris 10 and OpenSolaris prior to snv_109 that allows attackers to obtain sensitive information even when the screen is locked?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Stack-based buffer overflow in the _tt_internal_realpath function in the ToolTalk library (libtt.a) in IBM AIX 5.2.0, 5.3.0, 5.3.7 through 5.3.10, and 6.1.0 through 6.1.3, when the rpc.ttdbserver daemon is enabled in /etc/inetd.conf, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long XDR-encoded ASCII string to remote procedure 15.
column3: What vulnerability exists in the ToolTalk library in IBM AIX versions 5.2.0, 5.3.0 through 5.3.10, and 6.1.0 through 6.1.3, that could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: CA SiteMinder allows remote attackers to bypass cross-site scripting (XSS) protections for J2EE applications via a request containing a %00 (encoded null byte).
column3: What vulnerability does CA SiteMinder present that allows remote attackers to bypass XSS protections in J2EE applications?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: CA SiteMinder allows remote attackers to bypass cross-site scripting (XSS) protections for J2EE applications via a request containing non-canonical, "overlong Unicode" in place of blacklisted characters.
column3: What vulnerability in CA SiteMinder allows remote attackers to bypass XSS protections for J2EE applications, and how does it occur?

column1: Configuration
column2: The db2fmp process in IBM DB2 8 before FP17, 9.1 before FP5, and 9.5 before FP2 on Windows runs with "OS privilege," which has unknown impact and attack vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2008-3856.
column3: What are the implications of the "OS privilege" execution of the db2fmp process in IBM DB2 versions 8 before FP17, 9.1 before FP5, and 9.5 before FP2 on Windows, and how does this differ from the vulnerabilities described in CVE-2008-3856?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Heap-based buffer overflow in the JBIG2 filter in Adobe Reader 7 and Acrobat 7 before 7.1.3, Adobe Reader 8 and Acrobat 8 before 8.1.6, and Adobe Reader 9 and Acrobat 9 before 9.1.2 might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2009-0510, CVE-2009-0511, CVE-2009-0512, and CVE-2009-0889.
column3: What are the potential risks associated with the heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the JBIG2 filter of Adobe Reader and Acrobat versions prior to their specified updates?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Heap-based buffer overflow in the JBIG2 filter in Adobe Reader 7 and Acrobat 7 before 7.1.3, Adobe Reader 8 and Acrobat 8 before 8.1.6, and Adobe Reader 9 and Acrobat 9 before 9.1.2 might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2009-0510, CVE-2009-0511, CVE-2009-0512, and CVE-2009-0888.
column3: What security vulnerability affects multiple versions of Adobe Reader and Acrobat, potentially allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: Squid 3.0 through 3.0.STABLE16 and 3.1 through 3.1.0.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via malformed requests including (1) "missing or mismatched protocol identifier," (2) missing or negative status value," (3) "missing version," or (4) "missing or invalid status number," related to (a) HttpMsg.cc and (b) HttpReply.cc.
column3: What vulnerabilities are present in Squid versions 3.0 through 3.1.0.11 that allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service?

column1: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

column1: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
column2: The Admin media handler in core/servers/basehttp.py in Django 1.0 and 0.96 does not properly map URL requests to expected "static media files," which allows remote attackers to conduct directory traversal attacks and read arbitrary files via a crafted URL.
column3: What security vulnerability is present in the Admin media handler of Django versions 1.0 and 0.96 that could allow remote attackers to read arbitrary files?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: A certain debugging component in IBM AIX 5.3 and 6.1 does not properly handle the (1) _LIB_INIT_DBG and (2) _LIB_INIT_DBG_FILE environment variables, which allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging a setuid-root program to create an arbitrary root-owned file with world-writable permissions, related to libC.a (aka the XL C++ runtime library) in AIX 5.3 and libc.a in AIX 6.1.
column3: What vulnerability exists in the debugging component of IBM AIX 5.3 and 6.1 involving the _LIB_INIT_DBG and _LIB_INIT_DBG_FILE environment variables, and how can it be exploited by local users?

column1: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
column2: gpsdrive (aka gpsdrive-scripts) 2.10~pre4 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the (a) /tmp/.smswatch or (b) /tmp/gpsdrivepos temporary file, related to (1) examples/gpssmswatch and (2) src/splash.c, different vectors than CVE-2008-4959 and CVE-2008-5380.

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: PHP 5.2.5 does not enforce (a) open_basedir and (b) safe_mode_exec_dir restrictions for certain functions, which might allow local users to bypass intended access restrictions and call programs outside of the intended directory via the (1) exec, (2) system, (3) shell_exec, (4) passthru, or (5) popen functions, possibly involving pathnames such as "C:" drive notation.

NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information.

column1: Information Exposure
column2: ViewVC before 1.0.5 includes "all-forbidden" files within search results that list CVS or Subversion (SVN) commits, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information.

column1: Information Exposure
column2: ViewVC before 1.0.5 stores sensitive information under the web root with insufficient access control, which allows remote attackers to read files and list folders under the hidden CVSROOT folder.

column1: Information Exposure
column2: ViewVC before 1.0.5 provides revision metadata without properly checking whether access was intended, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading (1) forbidden pathnames in the revision view, (2) log history that can only be reached by traversing a forbidden object, or (3) forbidden diff view path parameters.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in ViewVC versions before 1.0.5 that could allow remote attackers to access sensitive information?

column2: The Cisco Linksys WVC54GC wireless video camera before firmware 1.25 sends cleartext configuration data in response to a Setup Wizard remote-management command, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information such as passwords by sniffing the network.

column3: What vulnerability exists in the NetCamPlayerWeb11gv2 ActiveX control on Cisco Linksys WVC54GC wireless video cameras prior to firmware 1.25, and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Credentials Management
column2: The password_check function in auth/auth_phpbb3.php in WoW Raid Manager 3.5.1 before Patch 1, when using PHPBB3 authentication, (1) does not invoke the CheckPassword function with the required arguments, which always triggers an authentication failure, and (2) returns true instead of false when an authentication failure occurs, which allows remote attackers to bypass authentication and gain privileges with an arbitrary password.

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls

column1: Configuration

column2: Mozilla Firefox 3.0.13 and earlier, 3.5, 3.6 a1 pre, and 3.7 a1 pre does not properly block data: URIs in Location headers in HTTP responses, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via vectors related to (1) injecting a Location header that contains JavaScript sequences in a data:text/html URI or (2) entering a data:text/html URI with JavaScript sequences when specifying the content of a Location header.  NOTE: the JavaScript executes outside of the context of the HTTP site.

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2:
PythonScripts in Zope 2 2.11.2 and earlier, as used in Conga and other products, allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (resource consumption or application halt) via certain (1) raise or (2) import statements. http://www.zope.org/Products/Zope/Hotfix-2008-08-12/README.txt

Affected Versions
* Zope 2.7.0 to Zope 2.11.2

---

http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/11/12/2

Affected Conga versions: - checked conga-0.9.1-8 (contains Zope2.7.5 RC2), conga-0.12.0-7.el5 (contains Zope-2.8.4),
                               - but older,newer Conga versions can be also vulnerable to this issue (based on Zope 2 version).
column3: What vulnerabilities are present in PythonScripts used in Zope 2 versions 2.7.0 to 2.11.2, and how can they affect applications like Conga?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2:
Unspecified vulnerability in Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.x through 9.1.2, and Adobe Flash Player 9.x through 9.0.159.0 and 10.x through 10.0.22.87, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via (1) a crafted Flash application in a .pdf file or (2) a crafted .swf file, related to authplay.dll, as exploited in the wild in July 2009. Per: http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/259425

"Adobe Flash is a widely deployed multimedia platform typically used to provide content in web sites. Adobe Flash Player, Reader, Acrobat, and other Adobe products include Flash support.

Adobe Flash Player contains a code execution vulnerability. An attacker may be able to trigger this vulnerability by convincing a user to open a specially crafted Flash (SWF) file. The SWF file could be hosted or embedded in a web page or contained in a Portable Document Format (PDF) file. If an attacker can take control of a website or web server, trusted sites may exploit this vulnerability.

This vulnerability affects Adobe Flash versions 9.0.159.0 and 10.0.22.87 and earlier 9.x and 10.x versions. Adobe Reader 9, Acrobat 9, and other Adobe products (including Photoshop CS3, PhotoShop Lightroom, Freehand MX, Fireworks) provide Flash support independent of Flash Player. As of 2009-07-22, Adobe Reader 9.1.2 includes Flash 9.0.155.0, which is likely vulnerable to issues addressed by Flash 9.0.159.0"
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in Adobe Reader, Acrobat, and Flash Player versions up to 9.1.2 and 10.0.22.87 that could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service?

column1: Cryptographic Issues

column1: Numeric Errors
column2:
Integer overflow in the vmx86 kernel extension in VMware Fusion before 2.0.6 build 196839 allows host OS users to cause a denial of service to the host OS via unspecified vectors. Per: http://lists.vmware.com/pipermail/security-announce/2009/000066.html 

Solution

   Please review the patch/release notes for your product and version
   and verify the md5sum and/or the sha1sum of your downloaded file.

   VMware Fusion 2.0.6 (for Intel-based Macs): Download including
   VMware Fusion and a 12 month complimentary subscription to McAfee
   VirusScan Plus 2009

   md5sum: d35490aa8caa92e21339c95c77314b2f
   sha1sum: 9c41985d754ac718032a47af8a3f98ea28fddb26

   VMware Fusion 2.0.6 (for Intel-based Macs): Download including only
   VMware Fusion software

   md5sum: 2e8d39defdffed224c4bab4218cc6659
   sha1sum: 453d54a2f37b257a0aad17c95843305250c7b6ef
column3: What issue was identified in VMware Fusion before version 2.0.6, and what steps should users take to ensure they download the correct and secure version?

column2: common/snapshots.py in Back In Time (aka backintime) 0.9.26 changes certain permissions to 0777 before deleting the files in an old backup snapshot, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading these files, or interfere with backup integrity by modifying files that are shared across snapshots.

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: mutt_ssl.c in mutt 1.5.19 and 1.5.20, when OpenSSL is used, does not properly handle a '\0' character in a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) field of an X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof arbitrary SSL servers via a crafted certificate issued by a legitimate Certification Authority, a related issue to CVE-2009-2408.

column1: Improper Authentication
column2:
The NDSD process in Novell eDirectory 8.7.3 before 8.7.3.10 ftf2 and eDirectory 8.8 before 8.8.5 ftf1 does not properly handle certain LDAP search requests, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application hang) via a search request with a NULL BaseDN value. Per: http://www.novell.com/support/viewContent.do?externalId=7004721

"Resolution

This vulnerability is resolved in eDirectory 8.8.5 ftf1 and eDirectory 8.7.3.10 ftf2.

To resolve this problem, apply eDirectory 8.8.5 ftf1 or newer for eDirectory 8.8.X and eDirectory 8.7.3.10 ftf2 for eDirectory 8.7.3.X.  Patches are available at http://download.novell.com"
column3: What vulnerability was identified in Novell eDirectory versions 8.7.3 before 8.7.3.10 ftf2 and 8.8 before 8.8.5 ftf1, and how can it be resolved?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: IOKit in Apple Mac OS X before 10.6.2 allows local users to modify the firmware of a (1) USB or (2) Bluetooth keyboard via unspecified vectors.
column3: What vulnerability in IOKit prior to Mac OS X 10.6.2 allows local users to modify the firmware of USB or Bluetooth keyboards?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2:
Help Viewer in Apple Mac OS X before 10.6.2 does not use an HTTPS connection to retrieve Apple Help content from a web site, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to send a crafted help:runscript link, and thereby execute arbitrary code, via a spoofed response. Per: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3937

    *

      Help Viewer

      CVE-ID: CVE-2009-2808

      Available for: Mac OS X v10.5.8, Mac OS X Server v10.5.8, Mac OS X v10.6 and v10.6.1, Mac OS X Server v10.6 and v10.6.1

      Impact: Using Help Viewer on an untrusted network may result in arbitrary code execution

      Description: Help Viewer does not use HTTPS for viewing remote Apple Help content. A user on the local network may send spoofed HTTP responses containing malicious help:runscript links. This update addresses the issue by using HTTPS when requesting remote Apple Help content. Credit to Brian Mastenbrook for reporting this issue.
column3: What security vulnerability was identified in Help Viewer for Apple Mac OS X versions prior to 10.6.2, and how can it potentially affect users on untrusted networks?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2:
Adaptive Firewall in Apple Mac OS X before 10.6.2 does not properly handle invalid usernames in SSH login attempts, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain login access via a brute-force attack (aka dictionary attack). Per: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3937

"This issue only affects Mac OS X Server systems. "
column3: What vulnerability in the Adaptive Firewall of Apple Mac OS X before 10.6.2 makes it susceptible to brute-force attacks on SSH login attempts specifically for Mac OS X Server systems?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2:
AFP Client in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 allows remote AFP servers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash) via unspecified vectors. Per: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3937

"These issues do not affect Mac OS X v10.6 systems"
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in AFP Client on Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 that can lead to arbitrary code execution or denial of service, and how do these issues differ in Mac OS X v10.6?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2:
Multiple buffer overflows in Apple Type Services (ATS) in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted embedded font in a document. Per: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3937

"These issues do not affect Mac OS X v10.6 systems"
column3: What vulnerabilities were found in Apple Type Services (ATS) in Mac OS X 10.5.8, and which version of Mac OS X is not affected by these issues?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: Certificate Assistant in Apple Mac OS X before 10.6.2 does not properly handle a '\0' character in a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) field of an X.509 certificate, which might allow man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof arbitrary SSL servers via a crafted certificate issued by a legitimate Certification Authority, a related issue to CVE-2009-2408.
column3: What vulnerability in Apple Mac OS X certificate handling prior to version 10.6.2 could allow man-in-the-middle attacks through improperly handled '\0' characters in the Common Name field of an X.509 certificate?

column1: Numeric Errors
column2: Multiple integer overflows in CoreGraphics in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted PDF document that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in CoreGraphics of Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8, and what potential impact do they have when exploiting crafted PDF documents?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2:
Heap-based buffer overflow in Disk Images in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 allows user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted FAT filesystem on a disk image. Per: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3937

"This issue does not affect Mac OS X v10.6"
column3: What vulnerability in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause application crashes through crafted FAT filesystems on disk images?

column2: The server in DirectoryService in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via unspecified vectors.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in the DirectoryService server of Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 that could be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Credentials Management
column2:
Event Monitor in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 does not properly handle crafted authentication data sent to an SSH daemon, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via vectors involving processing of XML log documents by other services, related to a "log injection" issue. Per: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3937


"This issue affects Mac OS X Server systems only"
column3: What is the impact of the Event Monitor vulnerability in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 specifically concerning SSH daemon and its relation to XML log document processing?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

NOTE: this might overlap CVE-2009-1515. Per http://lists.apple.com/archives/security-announce/2009/Nov/msg00000.html

"These issues do not affect systems prior to Mac OS X v10.6."
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in Christos Zoulas file before version 5.03 on Apple Mac OS X 10.6.x, and what potential impacts do they have on system security?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

Buffer overflow in FTP Server in Apple Mac OS X before 10.6.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a CWD command specifying a pathname in a deeply nested hierarchy of directories, related to a "CWD command line tool." Per: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3937

"This issue affects Mac OS X Server systems only"
column3: What type of vulnerability does the FTP Server in Apple Mac OS X before 10.6.2 have, and what potential impacts can it have on Mac OS X Server systems?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2:
Buffer overflow in the UCCompareTextDefault API in International Components for Unicode in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via unspecified vectors. Per: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3937

"This issue does not affect Mac OS X v10.6 systems"
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in the UCCompareTextDefault API of Mac OS X 10.5.8, and how do they potentially affect the system?

column2:

"This issue does not affect systems prior to Mac OS X v.10.6."

"A user may log in to any account without supplying a password"

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2:
freebsd-update in FreeBSD 8.0, 7.2, 7.1, 6.4, and 6.3 uses insecure permissions in its working directory (/var/db/freebsd-update by default), which allows local users to read copies of sensitive files after a (1) freebsd-update fetch (fetch) or (2) freebsd-update upgrade (upgrade) operation. Per: http://security.freebsd.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-09:17.freebsd-update.asc

"2) To patch your present system:

The following patch has been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3, 6.4,
7.1, 7.2, and 8.0 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:17/freebsd-update.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:17/freebsd-update.patch.asc"
column3: What vulnerability is associated with freebsd-update in FreeBSD versions 6.3, 6.4, 7.1, 7.2, and 8.0, and what steps can users take to patch their systems?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Asterisk Open Source 1.2.x before 1.2.35, 1.4.x before 1.4.26.3, 1.6.0.x before 1.6.0.17, and 1.6.1.x before 1.6.1.9; Business Edition A.x.x, B.x.x before B.2.5.12, C.2.x.x before C.2.4.5, and C.3.x.x before C.3.2.2; AsteriskNOW 1.5; and s800i 1.3.x before 1.3.0.5 generate different error messages depending on whether a SIP username is valid, which allows remote attackers to enumerate valid usernames via multiple crafted REGISTER messages with inconsistent usernames in the URI in the To header and the Digest in the Authorization header.
