column1: Configuration
column2: The default configuration of the web server in IBM Lotus Domino Server, possibly 6.0 through 8.0, enables the HTTP TRACE method, which makes it easier for remote attackers to steal cookies and authentication credentials via a cross-site tracing (XST) attack, a related issue to CVE-2004-2763 and CVE-2005-3398.
column3: What security vulnerability is associated with the default configuration of the web server in IBM Lotus Domino Server versions 6.0 through 8.0 that allows for possible cookie and authentication credential theft?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Tor before 0.2.1.22, and 0.2.2.x before 0.2.2.7-alpha, when functioning as a bridge directory authority, allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information about bridge identities and bridge descriptors via a dbg-stability.txt directory query.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in Tor versions prior to 0.2.1.22 and 0.2.2.x before 0.2.2.7-alpha regarding bridge directory authority queries?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: Martin Lambers msmtp before 1.4.19, when OpenSSL is used, does not properly handle a '\0' character in a domain name in the (1) subject's Common Name or (2) Subject Alternative Name field of an X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof arbitrary SSL servers via a crafted certificate issued by a legitimate Certification Authority, a related issue to CVE-2009-2408.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in Martin Lambers msmtp versions prior to 1.4.19 when using OpenSSL, specifically regarding the handling of '\0' characters in X.509 certificate fields?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: VERITAS File System (VxFS) 3.3.3, 3.4, and 3.5 before MP1 Rolling Patch 02 for Sun Solaris 2.5.1 through 9 does not properly implement inheritance of default ACLs in certain circumstances related to the characteristics of a directory inode, which allows local users to bypass intended file permissions by accessing a file on a VxFS filesystem.
column3: What vulnerability exists in VERITAS File System (VxFS) versions 3.3.3, 3.4, and 3.5 prior to MP1 Rolling Patch 02 for Sun Solaris that could allow local users to bypass file permissions?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2:
Buffer overflow in pamverifier in Change Manager (CM) 1.0 for Sun Management Center (SunMC) 3.0 on Solaris 8 and 9 on the sparc platform allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors. Per: http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-201231-1



    * "SunMC Change Manager" 1.0 is an unbundled Sun Management Center (SunMC) 3.0 add-on. It is not a part of the SunMC "base" product.
    * Solaris 2.6 and 7 are not affected. Solaris on the x86 platform is not affected.
column3: What are the implications of the buffer overflow vulnerability in pamverifier for Change Manager 1.0 in Sun Management Center 3.0 on Solaris 8 and 9?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Webmail in Sun ONE Messaging Server 6.1 and iPlanet Messaging Server 5.2 before 5.2hf2.02 allows remote attackers to obtain unspecified "access" to e-mail via a crafted e-mail message, related to a "session hijacking" issue, a different vulnerability than CVE-2005-2022 and CVE-2006-5486.
column3: What vulnerabilities related to session hijacking were identified in Sun ONE Messaging Server 6.1 and iPlanet Messaging Server 5.2 prior to 5.2hf2.02 that allow remote attackers to gain unauthorized access to e-mail?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Mozilla Necko, as used in Firefox, SeaMonkey, and other applications, performs DNS prefetching of domain names contained in links within local HTML documents, which makes it easier for remote attackers to determine the network location of the application's user by logging DNS requests.  NOTE: the vendor disputes the significance of this issue, stating "I don't think we necessarily need to worry about that case."
column3: What potential security concerns are associated with Mozilla Necko's DNS prefetching feature, and how does the vendor respond to these concerns?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2:
MeetingTime in Cisco Unified MeetingPlace 6 before MR5, and possibly 5, allows remote authenticated users to gain privileges via a modified authentication sequence, aka Bug ID CSCsv66530. Per: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080b1490b.shtml


Affected Products
Vulnerable Products

Cisco Unified MeetingPlace versions 5, 6, and 7 are each affected by at least one of the vulnerabilities described in this document.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with Cisco Unified MeetingPlace versions 5, 6, and 7 according to the advisory related to Bug ID CSCsv66530?

column1: Configuration
column2:
The default configuration of Sun Java System Application Server 7 and 7 2004Q2 enables the HTTP TRACE method, which makes it easier for remote attackers to steal cookies and authentication credentials via a cross-site tracing (XST) attack, a related issue to CVE-2004-2763 and CVE-2005-3398. Per: http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-200942-1


Contributing Factors

This issue can occur in the following releases:

    * Sun Java System Application Server Standard Edition 7 and later updates
    * Sun Java System Application Server Standard Edition 7 2004Q2 and later updates
    * Sun Java System Application Server Platform Edition 7 and later updates
column3: What security vulnerability is associated with the default configuration of Sun Java System Application Server 7 and 2004Q2 that allows remote attackers to steal cookies and authentication credentials?

column1: Information Exposure

column2: Tor before 0.2.1.22, and 0.2.2.x before 0.2.2.7-alpha, uses deprecated identity keys for certain directory authorities, which makes it easier for man-in-the-middle attackers to compromise the anonymity of traffic sources and destinations.

column1: Numeric Errors

column3: What vulnerability is present in Apache HTTP Server 2.0.44 regarding DNS resolution for client IP addresses, and how does it allow remote attackers to spoof IP addresses?

column3: What vulnerability was identified in Apache HTTP Server 2.0.44 related to DNS resolution and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in SpringSource tc Server 6.0.20.B and earlier, Application Management Suite (AMS) before 2.0.0.SR4, Hyperic HQ Open Source before 4.2.x, Hyperic HQ 4.0 Enterprise before 4.0.3.2, and Hyperic HQ 4.1 Enterprise before 4.1.2.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the description field and unspecified "input fields." Per: http://www.springsource.com/security/cve-2009-2907
 

'Mitigation:

    * Hyperic HQ Open Source users should upgrade to Hyperic HQ 4.2.x
    * Hyperic HQ 4.0 Enterprise users should upgrade to 4.2.x or 4.0.3.2
    * Hyperic HQ 4.1 Enterprise users should upgrade to 4.2.x or 4.1.2.1
    * Users of any earlier Enterprise version should upgrade to 4.2.x
    * AMS users should upgrade to 2.0.0.SR4
    * tc Server users should upgrade to AMS 2.0.0.SR4

To protect against this issue until systems have been upgraded and/or patches have been applied, system administrators should ensure untrusted users do not have the necessary privileges to create alerts.'
column3: What steps should users take to mitigate the multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities found in various versions of SpringSource tc Server and Hyperic HQ?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2:
The Accounts Preferences implementation in Apple Mac OS X 10.6 before 10.6.3, when a network account server is used, does not support Login Window access control that is based solely on group membership, which allows attackers to bypass intended access restrictions by entering login credentials. 'This issue only affects systems configured to use a network account server, and does not affect systems prior to Mac OS X v10.6.'
column3: What vulnerability related to Login Window access control exists in Apple Mac OS X 10.6 prior to version 10.6.3 when using a network account server?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: libESMTP, probably 1.0.4 and earlier, does not properly handle a '\0' character in a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) field of an X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof arbitrary SSL servers via a crafted certificate issued by a legitimate Certification Authority, a related issue to CVE-2009-2408.
column3: What issues arise from libESMTP versions 1.0.4 and earlier regarding the handling of '\0' characters in domain names within the Common Name field of an X.509 certificate, and how do they relate to CVE-2009-2408?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: The match_component function in smtp-tls.c in libESMTP 1.0.3.r1, and possibly other versions including 1.0.4, treats two strings as equal if one is a substring of the other, which allows remote attackers to spoof trusted certificates via a crafted subjectAltName.
column3: What vulnerability is associated with the match_component function in smtp-tls.c in libESMTP versions 1.0.3.r1 and possibly 1.0.4?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors related to (1) the Login-As feature or (2) when the global search feature is enabled, unspecified global search forms in the Global Search Engine.  NOTE: vector 1 might be resultant from a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability.
column3: What are the specific features in Moodle 1.8.x and 1.9.x that are associated with the XSS vulnerabilities, and how might vector 1 be related to CSRF?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
column2: Multiple SQL injection vulnerabilities in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via vectors related to (1) the add_to_log function in mod/wiki/view.php in the wiki module, or (2) "data validation in some forms elements" related to lib/form/selectgroups.php.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in Moodle versions 1.8.x and 1.9.x that allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: user/view.php in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 does not properly check a role, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain the full names of other users via the course profile page.
column3: What vulnerability was identified in user/view.php on Moodle versions 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8, and what information could remote authenticated users access as a result?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the phpCAS client library before 1.1.0, as used in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted URL, which is not properly handled in an error message.
column3: What is the impact of the cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the phpCAS client library used in specific versions of Moodle, and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the fix_non_standard_entities function in the KSES HTML text cleaning library (weblib.php), as used in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted HTML entities.
column3: What is the nature of the Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability identified in the KSES HTML text cleaning library used in specific versions of Moodle?

column1: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
column2: Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in hosting/admin_ac.php in ScriptsEz Mini Hosting Panel allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of administrators for requests that alter administrative settings via a cp action.
column3: What is the impact of the CSRF vulnerability in the ScriptsEz Mini Hosting Panel's hosting/admin_ac.php file?

column1: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
column2: Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in admin.php in Mail Manager Pro allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of administrators for requests that change the admin password via a change action.
column3: What is the potential security risk associated with the CSRF vulnerability in admin.php of Mail Manager Pro?

column1: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
column2: Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in administration/admins.php in Ad Manager Pro (aka AdManagerPro) 3.0 allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of administrators for requests that create new administrative users via an admin_created action.  NOTE: some of these details are obtained from third party information.
column3: What security vulnerability was discovered in Ad Manager Pro 3.0 that enables remote attackers to hijack administrator authentication and create new administrative users?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: Apple Java for Mac OS X 10.5 before Update 7 and Java for Mac OS X 10.6 before Update 2 do not properly handle mediaLibImage objects, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory access and application crash) via a crafted applet, related to the com.sun.medialib.mlib package.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with Apple Java for Mac OS X versions 10.5 before Update 7 and 10.6 before Update 2 related to mediaLibImage objects?

column1: Numeric Errors
column2: Integer signedness error in the window drawing implementation in Apple Java for Mac OS X 10.5 before Update 7 and Java for Mac OS X 10.6 before Update 2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted applet.
column3: What vulnerabilities were present in the window drawing implementation of Apple Java for Mac OS X 10.5 before Update 7 and Java for Mac OS X 10.6 before Update 2 that could be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

column3: What is the risk associated with the directory traversal vulnerability found in the TweetLA component for Joomla! version 1.0.1?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Stack-based buffer overflow in the media library in BS.Global BS.Player 2.51 build 1022, 2.41 build 1003, and possibly other versions allows user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long ID3 tag in a .MP3 file.  NOTE: some of these details are obtained from third party information.
column3: What vulnerability in BS.Player versions 2.51 build 1022 and 2.41 build 1003 allows user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary code, and how is this vulnerability exploited?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: Microsoft Dynamics GP uses a substitution cipher to encrypt the system password field and unspecified other fields, which makes it easier for remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive information by decrypting a field's contents.
column3: What method does Microsoft Dynamics GP use to encrypt its system password field, and what implications does this have for remote authenticated users?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

column1: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information.

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: The _gnutls_x509_oid2mac_algorithm function in lib/gnutls_algorithms.c in GnuTLS before 1.4.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted X.509 certificate that uses a hash algorithm that is not supported by GnuTLS, which triggers a NULL pointer dereference.
column3: What vulnerability is associated with the _gnutls_x509_oid2mac_algorithm function in GnuTLS versions prior to 1.4.2, and what is its impact?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Cross-Domain Controller (CDC) servlet in Sun Java System Access Manager 6 2005Q1, 7 2005Q4, and 7.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors. Per: http://secunia.com/advisories/35651

"NOTE: This only affects Sun Java System Access Manager if Cross-Domain Single Sign-On (CDSSO) functionality is enabled."
column3: What are the potential risks associated with the XSS vulnerability in the Cross-Domain Controller servlet of Sun Java System Access Manager, and under what conditions does this vulnerability become applicable?

http://typo3.org/extensions/repository/view/a21glossary/current/

column1: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
column2: Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in the web interface on the Cisco Scientific Atlanta WebSTAR DPC2100R2 cable modem with firmware 2.0.2r1256-060303 allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of administrators for requests that (1) reset the modem, (2) erase the firmware, (3) change the administrative password, (4) install modified firmware, or (5) change the access level, as demonstrated by a request to goform/_aslvl.
column3: What are the potential risks associated with the identified CSRF vulnerabilities in the web interface of the Cisco Scientific Atlanta WebSTAR DPC2100R2 cable modem?

column1: Improper Authentication
column2: The web interface on the Cisco Scientific Atlanta WebSTAR DPC2100R2 cable modem with firmware 2.0.2r1256-060303 allows remote attackers to bypass authentication, and reset the modem or replace the firmware, via a direct request to an unspecified page.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in the Cisco Scientific Atlanta WebSTAR DPC2100R2 cable modem that could allow remote attackers to bypass authentication and manipulate the device?

column1: Credentials Management
column2: The web interface on the Cisco Scientific Atlanta WebSTAR DPC2100R2 cable modem with firmware 2.0.2r1256-060303 has a default administrative password (aka SAPassword) of W2402, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain privileged access.
column3: What is the default administrative password for the Cisco Scientific Atlanta WebSTAR DPC2100R2 cable modem, and what security risk does this pose?

column1: Credentials Management
column2: Microsoft Dynamics GP has a default value of ACCESS for the system password, which might make it easier for remote authenticated users to bypass intended access restrictions via unspecified vectors.
column3: What are the potential security risks associated with Microsoft Dynamics GP's default system password of ACCESS, particularly for remote authenticated users?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Double free vulnerability in the krb5_def_store_mkey function in lib/kdb/kdb_default.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.5 has unknown impact and remote authenticated attack vectors.  NOTE: the free operations occur in code that stores the krb5kdc master key, and so the attacker must have privileges to store this key.
column3: What are the potential impacts and attack vectors associated with the double free vulnerability in the krb5_def_store_mkey function in MIT Kerberos 5 version 1.5?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: MoinMoin 1.7.x before 1.7.3 and 1.8.x before 1.8.3 checks parent ACLs in certain inappropriate circumstances during processing of hierarchical ACLs, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions by requesting an item, a different vulnerability than CVE-2008-6603.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in MoinMoin versions prior to 1.7.3 and 1.8.3 that allow remote attackers to bypass access restrictions?

column1: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')
column2: Race condition in the mod_auth_shadow module for the Apache HTTP Server allows remote attackers to bypass authentication, and read and possibly modify data, via vectors related to improper interaction with an external helper application for validation of credentials.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in the mod_auth_shadow module of the Apache HTTP Server that could allow remote attackers to bypass authentication and manipulate data?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Microsoft ASP.NET 2.0 does not prevent setting the InnerHtml property on a control that inherits from HtmlContainerControl, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via vectors related to an attribute.
column3: What security vulnerability is associated with Microsoft ASP.NET 2.0 regarding the InnerHtml property of controls that inherit from HtmlContainerControl?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: The default configuration of ASP.NET in Microsoft .NET before 1.1 has a value of FALSE for the EnableViewStateMac property, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via the __VIEWSTATE parameter.

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Apache MyFaces 1.1.7 and 1.2.8, as used in IBM WebSphere Application Server and other applications, does not properly handle an unencrypted view state, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks or execute arbitrary Expression Language (EL) statements via vectors that involve modifying the serialized view object.
column3: What security vulnerability is associated with Apache MyFaces versions 1.1.7 and 1.2.8 in IBM WebSphere Application Server, and what types of attacks can it enable?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

column3: What security vulnerability is associated with unencrypted view state handling in ASP.NET under Microsoft .NET 3.5, and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2:
Multiple PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in the MojoBlog component RC 0.15 for Joomla! allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via a URL in the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to (1) wp-comments-post.php and (2) wp-trackback.php. Per http://extensions.joomla.org/extensions/3374/details:

Editor's note

This extension has been unpublished for the following reason:

    * This extension is not compatible with Joomla! 1.5

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2:
UnrealIRCd 3.2.8.1, as distributed on certain mirror sites from November 2009 through June 2010, contains an externally introduced modification (Trojan Horse) in the DEBUG3_DOLOG_SYSTEM macro, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands. Per: http://www.unrealircd.com/txt/unrealsecadvisory.20100612.txt

'Official precompiled Windows binaries (SSL and non-ssl) are NOT affected.

CVS is also not affected.

3.2.8 and any earlier versions are not affected.

Any Unreal3.2.8.1.tar.gz downloaded BEFORE November 10 2009 should be safe, but you should really double-check, see next.'
column3: What vulnerabilities were found in UnrealIRCd 3.2.8.1, and how do they affect its users?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: nginx 0.8 before 0.8.40 and 0.7 before 0.7.66, when running on Windows, allows remote attackers to obtain source code or unparsed content of arbitrary files under the web document root by appending ::$DATA to the URI.
column3: What security vulnerability was discovered in nginx versions 0.8 before 0.8.40 and 0.7 before 0.7.66 when running on Windows?

column1: Improper Authentication
column2: Server Admin in Apple Mac OS X Server before 10.6.3 does not properly enforce authentication for directory binding, which allows remote attackers to obtain potentially sensitive information from Open Directory via unspecified LDAP requests.

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: Server Admin in Apple Mac OS X Server 10.5.8 does not properly determine the privileges of users who had former membership in the admin group, which allows remote authenticated users to leverage this former membership to obtain a server connection via screen sharing.
column3: What vulnerability exists in Apple Mac OS X Server 10.5.8 regarding user privileges and former admin group membership?

column1: Information Exposure
column2:
Wiki Server in Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 does not restrict the file types of uploaded files, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a Java applet. Per: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT4077

'This issue only affects Mac OS X Server systems, and does not affect versions 10.6 or later.'
column3: What vulnerability exists in Wiki Server on Apple Mac OS X 10.5.8 that could allow remote attackers to exploit the system, and how does it compare to versions 10.6 and later?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: Mail in Apple Mac OS X before 10.6.3 does not properly enforce the key usage extension during processing of a keychain that specifies multiple certificates for an e-mail recipient, which might make it easier for remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a brute-force attack on a weakly encrypted e-mail message.
column3: What security vulnerability was identified in Apple Mac OS X Mail prior to version 10.6.3 regarding the handling of keychains for e-mail recipients?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: Wiki Server in Apple Mac OS X 10.6 before 10.6.3 does not enforce the service access control list (SACL) for weblogs during weblog creation, which allows remote authenticated users to publish content via HTTP requests.
column3: What vulnerability exists in the Wiki Server of Apple Mac OS X 10.6 before version 10.6.3 that allows remote authenticated users to publish content?

column3: What security vulnerability exists in Dovecot on Apple Mac OS X 10.6 before 10.6.3 related to Kerberos and how does it affect email access control?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: The Client Interfaces component in IBM DB2 8.2 before FP18, 9.1 before FP8, 9.5 before FP5, and 9.7 before FP1 does not validate an unspecified pointer, which allows attackers to overwrite "external memory" via unknown vectors, related to a missing "check for null pointers."
column3: What vulnerability exists in the Client Interfaces component of IBM DB2 in certain versions that allows attackers to overwrite external memory?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: The RAND scalar function in the Common Code Infrastructure component in IBM DB2 9.5 before FP5 and 9.7 before FP1, when the Database Partitioning Feature (DPF) is used, produces "repeating" return values, which might allow attackers to defeat protection mechanisms based on randomization by predicting a value.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with the RAND scalar function in IBM DB2 9.5 and 9.7 when used with the Database Partitioning Feature (DPF)?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: The Common Code Infrastructure component in IBM DB2 9.5 before FP5 and 9.7 before FP1 does not properly validate the size of a memory pool during a creation attempt, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via unspecified vectors.
column3: What vulnerability exists in IBM DB2 9.5 before FP5 and 9.7 before FP1 related to memory pool creation, and what potential impact does it have?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: The Relational Data Services component in IBM DB2 9.5 before FP5 allows attackers to obtain the password argument from the SET ENCRYPTION PASSWORD statement via vectors involving the GET SNAPSHOT FOR DYNAMIC SQL command.
column3: What vulnerability in IBM DB2 9.5 before FP5 allows attackers to access the password argument from the SET ENCRYPTION PASSWORD statement?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: The Self Tuning Memory Manager (STMM) component in IBM DB2 9.1 before FP8, 9.5 before FP5, and 9.7 before FP1 uses 0666 permissions for the STMM log file, which allows local users to cause a denial of service or have unspecified other impact by writing to this file.
column3: What security vulnerability is associated with the Self Tuning Memory Manager (STMM) in IBM DB2 versions prior to certain fix packs, and what risks does it pose?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: PHP remote file inclusion vulnerability in cal_popup.php in the Anything Digital Development JCal Pro (aka com_jcalpro or JCP) component 1.5.3.6 for Joomla! allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via a URL in the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter.
column3: What is the nature of the PHP remote file inclusion vulnerability found in cal_popup.php of the Anything Digital Development JCal Pro component for Joomla! version 1.5.3.6?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: The Query Compiler, Rewrite, and Optimizer component in IBM DB2 9.1 before FP8, 9.5 before FP5, and 9.7 before FP1 does not enforce privilege requirements for access to a (1) sequence or (2) global-variable object, which allows remote authenticated users to make use of data via unspecified vectors.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in the Query Compiler, Rewrite, and Optimizer component of IBM DB2 versions 9.1, 9.5, and 9.7 regarding privilege enforcement for accessing sequences and global-variable objects?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: Install/Filesystem.pm in Bugzilla 3.5.1 through 3.6.1 and 3.7 through 3.7.1, when use_suexec is enabled, uses world-readable permissions within (1) .bzr/ and (2) data/webdot/, which allows local users to obtain potentially sensitive data by reading files in these directories, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-0180.
column3: What security vulnerability exists in Bugzilla versions 3.5.1 to 3.7.1 related to world-readable permissions when use_suexec is enabled?

column1: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
column2:
Multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in Splunk 4.0 through 4.0.10 and 4.1 through 4.1.1 allow (1) remote attackers to read arbitrary files, aka SPL-31194; (2) remote authenticated users to modify arbitrary files, aka SPL-31063; or (3) have an unknown impact via redirects, aka SPL-31067. Per: http://www.splunk.com/view/SP-CAAAFGD

'Splunk recommends that customers only apply the patch as a last resort, in situations where they are unable to upgrade immediately.'
column3: What are the specific directory traversal vulnerabilities identified in Splunk versions 4.0 to 4.1.1, and what does Splunk recommend regarding patch application?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Splunk 4.0 through 4.0.10 and 4.1 through 4.1.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via (1) redirects, aka SPL-31067; (2) unspecified "user->user or user->admin" vectors, aka SPL-31084; or (3) unspecified "user input," aka SPL-31085.
column3: What are the different vectors through which remote attackers can exploit multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Splunk versions 4.0 through 4.1.1?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2:
The S2 Security NetBox 2.5, 3.3, and 4.0, as used in the Linear eMerge 50 and 5000 and the Sonitrol eAccess, stores sensitive information under the web root with insufficient access control, which allows remote attackers to download node logs, photographs of persons, and backup files via unspecified HTTP requests. Per:  http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/MAPG-83TQL8

'Vendor Statement
S2 Security has made available patches or upgrades available to address this vulnerability in all versions of our product (2.5, 3.3, and 4.0). These are available through Linear Customer Support or S2 Customer Support'
column3: What vulnerabilities have been identified in the S2 Security NetBox versions 2.5, 3.3, and 4.0, and what measures have been taken by the vendor to address these issues?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2:
IBM FileNet Content Manager (CM) 4.0.0, 4.0.1, 4.5.0, and 4.5.1 before FP4 does not properly manage the InheritParentPermissions setting during an upgrade from 3.x, which might allow attackers to bypass intended folder permissions via unspecified vectors. Per: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21441225

'Fix Central can be found at: http://www-933.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/'
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in IBM FileNet Content Manager versions 4.0.0 to 4.5.1 before FP4 regarding the InheritParentPermissions setting during an upgrade from 3.x?

column3: What versions of MediaWiki are affected by the Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability that allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML through crafted Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) strings?

column1: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
column2: Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in the login interface in MediaWiki 1.15 before 1.15.4 and 1.16 before 1.16 beta 3 allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of users for requests that (1) create accounts or (2) reset passwords, related to the Special:Userlogin form.
column3: What security vulnerability was identified in MediaWiki versions 1.15 before 1.15.4 and 1.16 before 1.16 beta 3, and what actions could remote attackers perform as a result?

(dot dot) in a list name in a (1) edit or (2) save action.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in the mlmmj-php-admin web interface for the Mailing List Managing Made Joyful (mlmmj) versions 1.2.15 to 1.2.17, and what actions could remote authenticated users perform as a result?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: The GIGABYTE Dldrv2 ActiveX control 1.4.206.11 allows remote attackers to (1) download arbitrary programs onto a client system, and execute these programs, via vectors involving the dl method; and (2) download arbitrary programs onto a client system via vectors involving the SetDLInfo method in conjunction with the Bdl method.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with the GIGABYTE Dldrv2 ActiveX control version 1.4.206.11 that allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary programs on a client system?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: Array index error in the SetDLInfo method in the GIGABYTE Dldrv2 ActiveX control 1.4.206.11 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via the item argument.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with the SetDLInfo method in the GIGABYTE Dldrv2 ActiveX control version 1.4.206.11, and what potential consequences can they lead to?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: hsolinkcontrol in hsolink 1.0.118 allows local users to gain privileges via shell metacharacters in command-line arguments, as demonstrated by the second argument in a down action.
column3: What vulnerability was discovered in hsolink 1.0.118 that allows local users to gain privileges, and how can it be exploited?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in MoinMoin 1.7.3 and earlier, 1.8.x before 1.8.8, and 1.9.x before 1.9.3 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted content, related to (1) Page.py, (2) PageEditor.py, (3) PageGraphicalEditor.py, (4) action/CopyPage.py, (5) action/Load.py, (6) action/RenamePage.py, (7) action/backup.py, (8) action/login.py, (9) action/newaccount.py, and (10) action/recoverpass.py.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in MoinMoin versions 1.7.3 and earlier, as well as in 1.8.x before 1.8.8 and 1.9.x before 1.9.3, that could allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: The WDB target agent debug service in Wind River VxWorks 6.x, 5.x, and earlier, as used on the Rockwell Automation 1756-ENBT series A with firmware 3.2.6 and 3.6.1 and other products, allows remote attackers to read or modify arbitrary memory locations, perform function calls, or manage tasks via requests to UDP port 17185, a related issue to CVE-2005-3804.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with the WDB target agent debug service in Wind River VxWorks that could allow remote attackers to manipulate memory and tasks?

column1: Credentials Management
column2: The INCLUDE_SECURITY functionality in Wind River VxWorks 6.x, 5.x, and earlier uses the LOGIN_USER_NAME and LOGIN_USER_PASSWORD (aka LOGIN_PASSWORD) parameters to create hardcoded credentials, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain access via a (1) telnet, (2) rlogin, or (3) FTP session.
column3: What are the security vulnerabilities associated with the INCLUDE_SECURITY functionality in Wind River VxWorks 6.x and earlier versions due to hardcoded credentials?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: The loginDefaultEncrypt algorithm in loginLib in Wind River VxWorks before 6.9 does not properly support a large set of distinct possible passwords, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain access via a (1) telnet, (2) rlogin, or (3) FTP session.
column3: What vulnerabilities are associated with the loginDefaultEncrypt algorithm in Wind River VxWorks versions before 6.9 that may allow remote attackers to gain unauthorized access?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: The FTP daemon in Wind River VxWorks does not close the TCP connection after a number of failed login attempts, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain access via a brute-force attack.
column3: What security vulnerability exists in the FTP daemon of Wind River VxWorks regarding TCP connection management after failed login attempts?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in MoinMoin 1.7.3 and earlier, and 1.9.x before 1.9.3, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted content, related to (1) action/LikePages.py, (2) action/chart.py, and (3) action/userprofile.py, a similar issue to CVE-2010-2487.
column3: What vulnerabilities were identified in MoinMoin versions 1.7.3 and earlier, and 1.9.x prior to 1.9.3, that allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in MoinMoin 1.9.x before 1.9.3 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted content, related to (1) action/SlideShow.py, (2) action/anywikidraw.py, and (3) action/language_setup.py, a similar issue to CVE-2010-2487.
column3: What are the specific files in MoinMoin 1.9.x before 1.9.3 that are affected by the multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: BarnOwl before 1.6.2 does not check the return code of calls to the (1) ZPending and (2) ZReceiveNotice functions in libzephyr, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.
column3: What vulnerabilities were present in BarnOwl versions before 1.6.2 regarding the handling of return codes in the ZPending and ZReceiveNotice functions that could lead to denial of service or arbitrary code execution?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the IConfigurationAccess interface in the Invensys Wonderware Archestra ConfigurationAccessComponent ActiveX control in Wonderware Application Server (WAS) before 3.1 SP2 P01, as used in the Wonderware Archestra Integrated Development Environment (IDE) and the InFusion Integrated Engineering Environment (IEE), allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via the first argument to the UnsubscribeData method. Per: http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/703189

'According to Invensys, users that are using IAS 2.1 (all versions)-IDE, WAS 3.0 (all versions)-IDE, WAS 3.1 (all versions)-IDE, InFusion CE 2.0-IEE, InFusion FE 1.0 (all versions)-IEE, InFusion FE 2.0-IEE, InFusion SCADA 2.0IEE should apply the vendor security update. This vulnerability is not present in Wonderware Application Server 3.1 Service Pack 2 Patch 01 (WAS 3.1 SP2 P01).'
column3: What vulnerability was discovered in the IConfigurationAccess interface of the Invensys Wonderware Archestra ConfigurationAccessComponent ActiveX control, and which versions of the Wonderware Application Server are affected?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: The MS-ZIP decompressor in cabextract before 1.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a malformed MSZIP archive in a .cab file during a (1) test or (2) extract action, related to the libmspack library.
column3: What vulnerability is associated with the MS-ZIP decompressor in cabextract before version 1.3 that allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: Unspecified vulnerability in the SunRPC inspection feature on the Cisco Firewall Services Module (FWSM) with software 3.1 before 3.1(17.2), 3.2 before 3.2(16.1), 4.0 before 4.0(10.1), and 4.1 before 4.1(1.1) for Catalyst 6500 series switches and 7600 series routers allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (device reload) via crafted SunRPC messages, aka Bug ID CSCte61622.
column3: What vulnerability affects the SunRPC inspection feature on Cisco Firewall Services Module, and what potential impact could it have on devices running certain software versions?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x through 7.0.98.0 does not properly handle multiple SSH sessions, which allows physically proximate attackers to read a password, related to an "arrow key failure," aka Bug ID CSCtg51544.
column3: What vulnerability was identified in Cisco Unified Wireless Network Solution versions 7.x through 7.0.98.0, and what is the associated Bug ID?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x before 7.0.98.0 on 5508 series controllers allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer leak and device crash) via ARP requests that trigger an ARP storm, aka Bug ID CSCte43508.
column3: What vulnerability was identified in Cisco Unified Wireless Network Solution 7.x before version 7.0.98.0 on 5508 series controllers that allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x before 7.0.98.0 on 5508 series controllers allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (pbuf exhaustion and device crash) via fragmented traffic, aka Bug ID CSCtd26794.
column3: What vulnerability in the Cisco Unified Wireless Network Solution 7.x before version 7.0.98.0 affects 5508 series controllers and can be exploited by remote attackers to cause a denial of service?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x before 7.0.98.0 allows remote attackers to discover a group password via a series of SNMP requests, as demonstrated by an SNMP walk, aka Bug ID CSCtb74037.
column3: What vulnerability is associated with Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x prior to version 7.0.98.0, and how can it be exploited by remote attackers?

column1: Improper Authentication
column2: The base-files package before 5.0.0ubuntu7.1 on Ubuntu 9.10 and before 5.0.0ubuntu20.10.04.2 on Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, as shipped on Dell Latitude 2110 netbooks, does not require authentication for package installation, which allows remote archive servers and man-in-the-middle attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted package.
column3: What security vulnerability exists in the base-files package on Ubuntu 9.10 and 10.04 LTS that could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: JBoss Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) before 4.7 CP02 in JBoss Enterprise SOA Platform before 5.0.2 does not properly consider the security domain with which a service is secured, which might allow remote attackers to gain privileges by executing a service.
column3: What security vulnerability is present in JBoss Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) before version 4.7 CP02 and JBoss Enterprise SOA Platform before 5.0.2 that could allow remote attackers to gain privileges?

column1: Configuration
column2: The default configuration of the deployment descriptor (aka web.xml) in picketlink-sts.war in (1) the security_saml quickstart, (2) the webservice_proxy_security quickstart, (3) the web-console application, (4) the http-invoker application, (5) the gpd-deployer application, (6) the jbpm-console application, (7) the contract application, and (8) the uddi-console application in JBoss Enterprise SOA Platform before 5.0.2 contains GET and POST http-method elements, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions via a crafted HTTP request.
column3: What are the potential security vulnerabilities associated with the default configuration of the deployment descriptor in picketlink-sts.war across various quickstart applications in JBoss Enterprise SOA Platform before version 5.0.2?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in IBM WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) 6.3 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via (1) the searchTerm parameter to ServiceRegistry/HelpSearch.do or (2) the queryItems[0].value parameter to ServiceRegistry/QueryWizardProcessStep1.do.
column3: What are the specific parameters in IBM WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) 6.3 that are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks?

column1: Credentials Management
column2: The controller in Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x through 7.0.98.0 has (1) a default SNMP read-only community of public, (2) a default SNMP read-write community of private, and a value of "default" for the (3) SNMP v3 username, (4) SNMP v3 authentication password, and (5) SNMP v3 privacy password, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain access.

column2: Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x before 7.0.98.0 does not properly implement TLS and SSL, which has unspecified impact and remote attack vectors, aka Bug ID CSCtd01611.
column3: What are the security vulnerabilities associated with Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x prior to version 7.0.98.0, and what is the associated Bug ID?

column1: Cryptographic Issues
column2: Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x before 7.0.98.0 does not use an adequate message-digest algorithm for a self-signed certificate, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions via vectors involving collisions, aka Bug ID CSCtd67660.
column3: What vulnerability is present in Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x before 7.0.98.0 regarding self-signed certificates, and what can attackers exploit as a result?

column1: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
column2: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Cisco Wireless Control System (WCS) 7.x before 7.0.164, as used in Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x before 7.0.98.0, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors, aka Bug ID CSCtg33854.

column2: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x before 7.0.98.0 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors, aka Bug ID CSCtf35333.
column3: What is the nature of the vulnerability related to Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x and what could be the potential impact on users?

column1: Resource Management Errors
column2: The originates_from_local_legacy_unicast_socket function in avahi-core/server.c in avahi-daemon 0.6.23 does not account for the network byte order of a port number when processing incoming multicast packets, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (network bandwidth and CPU consumption) via a crafted legacy unicast mDNS query packet that triggers a multicast packet storm.
column3: What vulnerability is present in the avahi-daemon 0.6.23 related to the processing of multicast packets, and what potential attack does it enable?

column1: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
column2: Buffer overflow in the MSGFunctionDemarshall function in winscard_svc.c in the PC/SC Smart Card daemon (aka PCSCD) in MUSCLE PCSC-Lite 1.5.4 and earlier might allow local users to gain privileges via crafted SCARD_CONTROL message data, which is improperly demarshalled.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2010-0407.
column3: What vulnerability exists in the MSGFunctionDemarshall function of the PC/SC Smart Card daemon in MUSCLE PCSC-Lite 1.5.4 and earlier, and what could it allow local users to do?

column1: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
column2: The IICAClient interface in the ICAClient library in the ICA Client ActiveX Object (aka ICO) component in Citrix Online Plug-in for Windows for XenApp & XenDesktop before 12.0.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via a crafted HTML document that triggers the reading of a .ICA file.
column3: What vulnerabilities exist in the IICAClient interface of the ICAClient library in the Citrix Online Plug-in for Windows for XenApp & XenDesktop prior to version 12.0.3, and how can they be exploited by remote attackers?

column2: Multiple SQL injection vulnerabilities in Pligg before 1.1.1 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the title parameter to (1) storyrss.php or (2) story.php.

column2: SQL injection vulnerability in index.php in Tycoon Baseball Script 1.0.9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the game_id parameter in a game_player action.

column2: SQL injection vulnerability in statistics.php in PHPKick 0.8 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the gameday parameter in an overview action.

column2: Client.cpp in ZNC 0.092 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (exception and daemon crash) via a PING command that lacks an argument.

column1: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
column2: Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Tomaz Muraus Open Blog 1.2.1, and possibly earlier, allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of administrators for requests that change the administrative password.  NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information.
column3: What are the potential implications of the CSRF vulnerability found in Tomaz Muraus Open Blog 1.2.1 regarding the security of administrator accounts?

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2:
Integer overflow in IOSurface in Apple iOS before 4.0.2 on the iPhone and iPod touch, and before 3.2.2 on the iPad, allows local users to gain privileges via vectors involving IOSurface properties, as demonstrated by JailbreakMe. Per: http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/60856

'Platforms Affected:

    * Apple iPhone OS 4.0 iPodtouch
    * Apple iPhone OS 4.0
    * Apple iPhone OS 4.0.1 iPodtouch
    * Apple iPhone OS 4.0.1 '


Per: http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/42151/discuss

'versions 4.0.1 and prior are vulnerable.'
column3: What vulnerabilities were present in Apple iOS versions before 4.0.2 that allowed local users to gain privileges, and which devices were affected?

column1: Improper Input Validation
column2: Cisco IOS 15.1(2)T allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption and TCP outage) via spoofed TCP packets, related to embryonic TCP connections that remain in the SYN_RCVD or SYN_SENT state, aka Bug ID CSCti18193.

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: gnome-power-manager 2.14.0 does not properly implement the lock_on_suspend and lock_on_hibernate settings for locking the screen when the suspend or hibernate button is pressed, which might make it easier for physically proximate attackers to access an unattended laptop via a resume action, a related issue to CVE-2010-2532.

column1: Permissions Privileges and Access Controls
column2: gnome-power-manager 2.27.92 does not properly implement the lock_on_suspend and lock_on_hibernate settings for locking the screen when the suspend or hibernate button is pressed, which might make it easier for physically proximate attackers to access an unattended laptop via a resume action, a related issue to CVE-2010-2532.  NOTE: this issue exists because of a regression that followed a gnome-power-manager fix a few years earlier.
column3: What security vulnerability is associated with gnome-power-manager 2.27.92 regarding screen locking during suspend or hibernate, and how is it related to CVE-2010-2532?

column1: Information Exposure
column2: BbtsConnection_Edit.exe in Blackboard Transact Suite (formerly Blackboard Commerce Suite) before 3.6.0.2 relies on field names when determining whether it is appropriate to decrypt a connection.xml field value, which allows local users to discover the database password via a modified connection.xml file that contains an encrypted password in the <Server> field.

(dot dot) sequences, related to the combination of the unix extensions and wide links options.
